main event: A civilian observed an unusual object in Washington, D.C. on October 28, 1966, which lasted for 3 to 5 seconds.
interesting points: The observer described a bluish white flame accompanying the object,The sighting was reported to the Washington Post, but only received an automated response,Two diagrams were submitted which approximated the location of the object,The report concluded that the sighting was likely a meteor,The sketch and diagrams included various annotations and labels related to the sighting.
sighted object: an unusual object emitting a bluish white flame
